input.source_text:
Annual Environmental Impact Report 2024

Carbon Emissions: Our total carbon emissions decreased by 12% year-over-year to 45,000 metric tons CO2e. Scope 1 emissions were 15,000 tons, Scope 2 were 20,000 tons, and Scope 3 were 10,000 tons. The reduction was primarily driven by our transition to renewable energy sources at three manufacturing facilities.

Water Usage: Total water consumption was 2.3 million gallons, a 5% increase due to expansion of our Singapore facility. We recycled 68% of water used in manufacturing processes.

Waste Management: We diverted 82% of waste from landfills through recycling and composting programs. Hazardous waste generation decreased by 18% to 120 tons.
input.instruction: What were the main drivers of carbon emission reduction, and how did Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions compare?
input.reference_output: The main driver of carbon emission reduction was the transition to renewable energy at three manufacturing facilities. Scope 2 emissions were the largest at 20,000 tons, followed by Scope 1 at 15,000 tons, and Scope 3 at 10,000 tons.

output.generated_text: The carbon emission reduction of 12% (to 45,000 metric tons CO2e) was primarily driven by transitioning three manufacturing facilities to renewable energy sources. By scope: Scope 2 (indirect energy) was largest at 20,000 tons, Scope 1 (direct) was 15,000 tons, and Scope 3 (value chain) was 10,000 tons.
